bytebase.store.Label.schema.strict.json.description: Label represents a categorization tag that can be applied to issues.

color.description: The color for the label in hex format (e.g., "#FF0000").

group.description: Optional group name for organizing related labels.

value.description: The display text of the label.

bytebase.store.Label.schema.strict.json.title: Label

bytebase.store.Project.ExecutionRetryPol.description: ExecutionRetryPolicy defines retry behavior for failed task executions.

maximum_retries.description: The maximum number of retry attempts for lock timeout errors.

bytebase.store.Project.ExecutionRetryPol.title: Execution Retry Policy

bytebase.store.Project.schema.strict.jso.description: Project contains settings and configuration for a Bytebase project.

allow_modify_statement.description: Allow modifying statement after issue is created.

allow_self_approval.description: Whether to allow the issue creator to self-approve the issue.

ci_sampling_size.description:
The maximum number of databases to sample during CI data validation.
 If not specified, sampling is disabled, resulting in a full validation.

enforce_issue_title.description: Enforce issue title created by user instead of generated by Bytebase.

enforce_sql_review.description:
Whether to enforce SQL review checks to pass before issue creation.
 If enabled, issues cannot be created when SQL review finds errors.

execution_retry_policy.description: Configuration for automatic retry on task execution failures.

force_issue_labels.description: Force issue labels to be used when creating an issue.

issue_labels.description: Available labels that can be applied to issues in this project.

labels.description:
Labels are key-value pairs that can be attached to the project.
 For example, { "environment": "production", "team": "backend" }

parallel_tasks_per_rollout.description: The maximum number of parallel tasks to run during the rollout.

postgres_database_tenant_mode.description:
Whether to enable the database tenant mode for PostgreSQL.
 If enabled, the issue will be created with the prepend "set role <db_owner>" statement.

skip_backup_errors.description: Whether to skip backup errors and continue the data migration.

bytebase.store.Project.schema.strict.jso.title: Project
